intro: Trichelostylis capillaris, commonly known as the slender spike orchid, is a species of orchid native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. It has fibrous roots and is often found in coastal regions, where it tolerates saline conditions. Trichelostylis capillaris is a terrestrial orchid that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
